conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on object A and determine the height it rises and the stiffness coefficient k2 of the light spring C.
B is fixed on the horizontal surface.
C is connected to B and has a spring constant k2.
The right endpoint of C is at position a.
The light rope on the upper end of A is just vertically straight.

premise: The gravitational force of A is mg = 2kg × 9.8m/s² = 19.6N.
conclusion: The gravitational force acting on A is 19.6N.

premise: The tension force in the rope on the upper end of A is T = mg = 19.6N.
conclusion: The tension force in the rope is 19.6N.

premise: The force of the spring in B is k1x = 200N/m × 0.6m = 120N.
conclusion: The force exerted by spring B is 120N.

premise: The force of the spring in C is k2x = k2 × 0.6m.
conclusion: The force exerted by spring C is k2 × 0.6m.

premise: The tension force in the rope on the upper end of A is equal to the gravitational force of A.
conclusion: The tension force equals the gravitational force of A.

premise: The force of the spring in B is equal to the force of the spring in C.
conclusion: The force exerted by spring B equals the force exerted by spring C.

premise: The force of the spring in C is equal to the force of the spring in B.
conclusion: The force exerted by spring C equals the force exerted by spring B.

premise: The equation of motion for A is mẍ = -k1x - k2x.
conclusion: The equation of motion for A is mẍ = -k1x - k2x.

premise: Substituting the values of k1 and k2, we get mẍ = -200N/m × 0.6m - k2 × 0.6m.
The height that object A rises is x = 1/2 × mẍ/k2.
conclusion: The height A rises is x = 1/2 × mẍ/k2.
